medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant pain with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a history of two previous episodes of right upper quadrant pain consistent with cholelithiasis, but without acute inflammation. Today's presentation includes similar symptoms of right upper quadrant pain along with nausea and vomiting. The patient denies fever, chills, or any other gastrointestinal or respiratory symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative colitis status post colectomy with J-pouch, hypertension, proctocolectomy with ileoanal anastomosis and J-pouch, ileostomy takedown, total abdominal hysterectomy with hematoma and subsequent drain, appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has rheumatoid arthritis and pulmonary fibrosis; father has skin cancer.
